meanings.definition: To cover or coat with a hard layer
meanings.sent1: The barnacles were encrusting the ship's hull, making it difficult to sail smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The artist was encrusting the sculpture with colorful gemstones to enhance its beauty.
meanings.sent3: The cookies were encrusting the jar so tightly that even the strongest person couldn't open it!
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to be encrusting her memories with a layer of nostalgia, making them more precious.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ruins were encrusting with moss, giving them a mysterious and ancient look.

meanings.definition: To form a hard layer on the surface of something
meanings.sent1: The rust was slowly encrusting the old pipes, causing them to leak.
meanings.sent2: The saltwater was encrusting the rocks along the shore, creating a beautiful natural pattern.
meanings.sent3: The snow was encrusting the trees, turning the whole forest into a winter wonderland.
meanings.sent4: The dust was encrusting the forgotten books on the shelf, hiding their titles from view.
meanings.sent5: The lava was encrusting the volcano's crater, sealing its fiery core from view.
